page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: Mr. Robert Phillipson came to talk to us about some of the changes in farming that he had experienced.Before World War Two every farmer used horses to plough and pull any machinery they used. Every farm had farm servants, both men and women,that is the reason why many farmhouses are so large as the servants all lived in the farm. There were hiring fairs at Ulverston at Martinmas and Whitsuntide.Any young man or girl who wanted to be hired put a piece of hay or straw in their hat.A farmer who wanted a servant would talk to them and then he might hire them for six months. Nowadays most farms are worked by the farmer and his family.
